Articles.Content:
Hum. Adulthood?

Nope but close

Words?

Thats all I can think of
Childhood, more like the joy of childhood?
Nothing so far
Dreams perhaps?

Is it success?

Edited February 10, 2015 by vexx32

No none of these really fit all of them, you can reach success by what you define it as. Childhood and Adulthood can be defined biologically as certain areas of your life

I cause fear and hope and joy and depression

I am never taught in any lesson

I hold infinite infinities

The next step in reality

My stories you could never imagine

Though if you come close you'll be read by millions

I can never really be truly breached

My lands you will never reach

What am I?
are you possibilities?

The mind of an adolescent?

Books?

Edited February 10, 2015 by Bill Phil
A past life/dead person/historical figure?

are you possibilities?
The mind of an adolescent?

Books?

A past life/dead person/historical figure?

None of these, but B787_300 was closest
is the answer "potential"?
The being not alive. Before you were born.

is the answer "potential"?

Very close but potential normally can't be counted as a place

Hrm if potential and possibilities are close, then could it be opportunities

But that does not really have a place...
Perfection/Utopia?
All the possible parallel universes?

Possibilities - theories/un-falsifiable assumptions.

"I cause fear and hope and joy and depression" [i guess you just needed extra syllables?] Perspective/invoking of emotion

"I am never taught in any lesson" The subject is to be discovered by individuals only, who really want to know

"I hold infinity infinites" [There are tons upon tons of problems with that statement] It is omnipotent or all encompassing

"The next step in reality" It is beyond our reach

"My stories you could never imagine" It is beyond our comprehension

"Though if you come close you'll be read by millions" Approaching this status, whatever it is, will be exclusively recorded in history

"I can never be truly breached" No matter the damage or drawback, it will always bounce back

"My lands you will never reach" You are not capable of being one of which is on this "land"

Perspective automatically limits the answer to a decently short pool.

The second line implies it is something you learn yourself, which limits it much further.

The third, fourth, and fifth lines imply that it is beyond you on a level comparable to omnipotence. Not much limiting here.

The sixth line... implies a concept? If you are this, you'll be essentially famous... I thought we were talking about perspective, No?

The seventh and eighth lines seem to imply that it is guarding something, or is impossible to understand.

So altogether, an emotional invoking, all encompassing concept that we cannot understand, but can become part of it. It is not widely held up by the people as a whole, but by the individuals.

But wait... "A place"? That contradicts the sixth line. How can a place be the herald acceptance as a valuable being, AND a concept at the same time?

Is this riddle based on a belief? In that case, any answer could technically be true if the one who submitted it believes it is the right one, as long as it fits the criteria of the riddle and their own.

It isn't based on any belief, possibilities is very close but not the answer I'm looking for.

Think of where possibility is

I cause fear and hope and joy and depression

I am never taught in any lesson

I hold infinite infinities

The next step in reality

My stories you could never imagine

Though if you come close you'll be read by millions

I can never really be truly breached

My lands you will never reach

What am I?
Is it imagination?

Is it imagination?

No but imagination is frequently occupied by it
The future?

The future?

That's it you got it.

Sweet! A quick one I threw together:

Twisting words and making rhyme,

All for pleasure to pass the time.

Filled with meaning and knowledge obscure,

I'll challenge your mind of this I'm sure.

Others try to pass my test,

But mine are harder than the rest.

My words sometimes fill some with fear,

Been sharing them for over a year.
Is it a riddle or a riddler?
